oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nourse Family Photograph
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Family photograph depicts four children standing in the back, two adults sitting in front of them, and four children standing and sitting next to them. Back row (left to right): Nourse, Julia (b. 1907). Front row (left to right): Nourse, Rush; Nourse, Laura (b. 1910); Hitchcock, Mildred (b.1889); Nourse, Blanch (b. 1920). Also pictured: Nourse, Leverne (b. 1906); Nourse, Floyd (b. 1909); Nourse, Irving (b. 1914); and Nourse, Rush (b. 1916). Individuals pictured are formally dressed. Slide of black-and-white photograph.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Unknown
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Family; Photographs
People

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Program for the Prize Speaking Contest of the Erieville Union School
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Slide of black-and-white photograph depicts a program from the Prize Speaking Contest. The document reads, "Prize Speaking Contest of the Erieville Union School, Friday Evening, June 19th, 1915...Program...Music Recitation, 'The Correction of Bennie,' Grace Van Wyk. Declamation, 'America's Coming Greatness,' Leon Hudson. Recitation, 'Bobby' Fannie Spaulding. Song, Majorie and Lena Briggs. Declamation, 'The Lad,' Duane Purdy. Recitation, 'The Battle of the Strong,' Rachel Jones. Declamation, 'The One-Legged Goose,' Delos McKinstry. Vocal Duet, 'Whispering Hope,' Marjorie Beeman, Clinton Owen. Recitation, 'A Tale of Old Madrid,' Elsie Beebe. Declamation, 'A Soldier of France,' Frank Killeen. Music Selections, Miss Cody. Decision of Judges. Awarding of Prizes."
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Erieville Union School
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Programs; Education
Community & Events; Education; Arts & Entertainment

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photograph of House Belonging to Brown, Palmer, Erieville, New York
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Slide of black-and-white photograph depicts house belonging to Brown, Palmer. Several children pose in front of the house, while three more are pictured in the background. The house no longer stands. Presently, the land serves as the fire house parking lot. Brown, Palmer (1857-1944) was the Town Supervisor, an Erieville Union School trustee, and a Grange Master. The photograph reads, "Maple Ave." and "Erieville, N.Y."

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Johnson Hotel, Built in 1885
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Johnson Hotel, built in 1885 to replace the one that burned the year before. The fire started at the sawmill by the railroad. 57 other fires resulted from this fire.
